definition: to mend one's ways (idiom)/to turn over a new leaf
to change/to alter/to transform/to correct
demonic/iniquitous/nefarious/evil/unhealthy influences that cause disease (Chinese medicine)/(coll.) strange/abnormal
surname Gui

to return/to go back to/to give back to/(of a responsibility) to be taken care of by/to belong to/to gather together/(used between two identical verbs) despite/to marry (of a woman) (old)/division on the abacus with a one-digit divisor
first month of the lunar year
straight/upright/proper/main/principal/to correct/to rectify/exactly/just (at that time)/right (in that place)/(math.) positive

sentences.english: If you don't get straightened out, you will end up in jail.
sentences.chinese: 如果你不改邪歸正的話，最終要進監獄的。

sentences.english: Maybe religion should help to straighten him out.
sentences.chinese: 也許宗教信仰可以使他改邪歸正。

sentences.english: However, he thought, is right, with all my heart from crime career.
sentences.chinese: 然而他一心所想，卻是改邪歸正，擺脫犯罪生涯。

sentences.english: A smile to turn any sinner saintly.
sentences.chinese: 她的微笑足以讓任何罪人改邪歸正。

sentences.english: You'll find yourself in prison if you don't mend your way.
sentences.chinese: 如果你不改邪歸正，你肯定要進監獄的。

sentences.english: Fixing wrong doings and returning to socialism is the only correct way!
sentences.chinese: 改邪歸正爸，回到社會主義纔是唯一正確的路。

sentences.english: home， Changhu knelt before his mother， bitterly remorseful. He finally gave up evil and returned to good.
sentences.chinese: 長怙回來後跪在母親面前，悔恨交加，從此改邪歸正。

sentences.english: The seven trumpets are God's warning to humans to repent and change their ways.
sentences.chinese: 七枝號代表上帝給人的警告，要我們悔罪並改邪歸正。

definition: to have no sense of shame/brazen
crafty/slippery/slyboots
traitor to one's love/heartless rat
to play the fool (idiom)/to feign madness
ashamed and unable to show one's face
reckless/extremely daring
lit. chickens flying and dogs jumping (idiom)/fig. in chaos/in disarray
devoid of conscience (idiom); utterly heartless
a spy/a crafty person
to blame sb wrongly
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
lit. not even the chickens and dogs are left undisturbed (idiom)/fig. great commotion/pandemonium
to step down gracefully (humble expression)/to concede defeat/to play second fiddle
confused/vague/indistinct/muddle-headed/mixed up/in a daze
to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: chicken-hearted (idiom)/gutless
